ns0:Resource.title: 6dF Galaxy Survey Data Release 3

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: 6dF survey galaxy galaxies redshift redshifts 2MASS
content.description: The 6dF Galaxy Survey (6dFGS) aims to measure the redshifts of around 150 000 galaxies, and the peculiar velocities of a 15 000-member subsample, over almost the entire southern sky. The table called Spectra contains the redshifts and qualities of all the observations. When complete, it will be the largest redshift survey of the nearby Universe, reaching out to about z ~ 0.15, and more than an order of magnitude larger than any peculiar velocity survey to date. The targets are all galaxies brighter than K tot = 12.75 in the 2MASS Extended Source Catalog (XSC), supplemented by 2MASS and SuperCOSMOS galaxies that complete the sample to limits of (H, J , r F, bJ) = (13.05, 13.75, 15.6, 16.75). This is the Data Release 3 version.

parameterDefinition.name: Query
parameterDefinition.description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

parameterDefinition.name: RA column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Right-Ascension column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: DEC column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Declination column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: Find Mode
parameterDefinition.description: Find mode for matches: BEST or ALL

parameterDefinition.name: Input VOTable
parameterDefinition.description: Input VOTable, containing Right Ascension and Declination columns, for matching against
